NewsBreak: Hong Kong Stock Exchange Makes Surprise Bid to Buy LSE

Stock Markets 5 hours ago (Sep 11, 2019 05:18AM ET)

© Reuters. Investing.com - Hong Kong Exchange and Clearing (HK: ) has made a surprise bid to purchase London Stock Exchange Group (LON: ), the company said in statements to both exchanges. The bid values LSE, one of Europe’s largest exchanges at $36.6 billion (29.6 billion pounds) “Bringing HKEX and LSEG together will redefine global capital markets for decades to come,” HKEX Chief Executive Charles Li said in a statement Wednesday. “Both businesses have great brands, financial strength and proven growth track records.” The bid threatens to disrupt LSE Group's agreement to buy data provider Refinitiv for $27 billion.
